<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Variables

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element.
* To remove a variable, set it to [[nil]] (e.g. <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[player]] [[setVariable]] ["varname", [[nil]]<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>]</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>;</value></part></template>).<br><br>
* When variable is set on [[Task]], it is not actually set on task itself, but on FSM attached to the task. So if there is no FSM [[setVariable]] will not work.<br>
* When variable is set on [[Location]], it works only with locations created with [[createLocation]].<br><br>
* All supported variable types:
** [[Namespace]], [[Object]], [[Group]], [[Team Member]], [[Task]] (FSM Task), [[Location]] ([[createLocation | scripted]] only)
** [[Control]] and [[Display]] <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.55.133553</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>In Arma 3 it is possible to broadcast [[nil]] value!</value></part></template>


</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> <template><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> [[missionNamespace]], [[uiNamespace]], [[parsingNamespace]] and [[profileNamespace]] variable names could be any string, except for the reserved names, which are normally script command names. For example: <tt>[[missionNamespace]] setVariable ["west", 123];</tt> will result in error: 
 Error in expression <missionNamespace setVariable ["west", 123];>
    Error position: <setVariable ["west", 123];>
    Error Reserved variable in expression  
as [[west]] is a script command. Other varspaces do not have such limitation. You can always check for all available script commands by running [[Arma_3_Utilities#Script_Commands | utility number 5]]</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> varspace [[setVariable]] [name, value]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> varspace: [[Namespace]], [[Object]], [[Group]], [[Team Member]], [[Task]], [[Location]], [[Control]], [[Display]] - variable space in which variable can be set
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [name, value]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> name: [[String]] - variable name
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> value: [[Anything]] - variable value

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name> s2 </name>=<value> varspace [[setVariable]] [name, value, public]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> varspace: [[missionNamespace]], [[Object]] or [[Group]] - variable space in which variable can be set
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [name, value, public]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> name: [[String]] - variable name
</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> value: [[Anything]] - variable value (if public is [[true]], check [[publicVariable]] for what types are supported for broadcast)
</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> public: [[Boolean]], [[Number]] or [[Array]] of [[Number]]s
* [[Boolean]] - when [[true]], the variable broadcast is global and persistent <template><title>Icon</title><part><name index="1"/><value>globalEffect</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>32</value></part></template>
* [[Number]] - the variable is set only on the client of given [[owner]] ([[clientOwner]]) id, or if id is negative, the variable is set on every client except the given one
* [[Array]] of [[Number]]s - array of [[owner]] ([[clientOwner]]) ids

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_myTruck [[setVariable]] ["myPublicVariable", 123, [[true]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_myTruck [[setVariable]] ["myLocalVariable", ["321", _var], [[false]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[missionNamespace]] [[setVariable]] ["myName", "KK"];
[[hint]] myName; //KK</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> Get current value of a variable and if it is undefined, define it and get the defined value:<code>[[private]] _var = [[missionNamespace]] [[getVariable]] "varName";
[[if]] ([[isNil]] "_var") [[then]]
{
	[[missionNamespace]] [[setVariable]] ["varName", 123]; 
	_var = 123;
};
// _var here will contain current value of the variable varName</code>

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> The variable space of the object is '''local to each client''' and '''by default''' changes are not broadcast.<br>
Since Arma 2: '''If''' the '''public''' parameter for supported types is ''<tt>true</tt>'', the value will be '''synchronized''' also for a [[Multiplayer Scripting#Join In Progress|JIP]] player.

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getVariable]], [[allVariables]], [[setFSMVariable]], [[Multiplayer Scripting#Join In Progress|Multiplayer Scripting]]
</value></part></template>
